article.headline: UAB 86, Marquette 63
article.story: MILWAUKEE (AP) -- Demario Eddins matched his season high with 23 points to go with nine rebounds, leading UAB to an 86-63 victory over Marquette Wednesday night. The Blazers, outscoring Marquette 50-6 in the paint, got 18 points from Eddins in the second half. For the game, the junior forward was 8-of-10 from the field and 7-of-8 from the free-throw line. UAB (16-5, 6-2 Conference USA) hadn't won at Marquette since Jan. 7, 1998, and beat the Golden Eagles for just the third time in 11 games at the Bradley Center. Donell added 15 points, four assists, three rebounds and two steals for the Blazers, who had just five turnovers compared to Marquette's 22. They now have won their last three games. Marquette (15-6, 3-5) was playing its third straight game without Travis Diener. The senior guard, who leads the league in scoring with 20.2 points per game, has a minor stress fracture in his left foot. Joe Chapman led Marquette with a career-high 21 points, including 19 in the first half when he made all six of his shots, including five 3-pointers. But Chapman missed all three of his shots in the second half before he hurt his left knee with 7:29 left and had to be helped off the court. Steve Novak added 16 points and six rebounds for Marquette. UAB, which shot 57.7 percent from the field in the second half, went on a 17-2 run, starting late in the first half with Marquette leading 39-34, to take control. Marquette shot 61 percent from the field in the first half but missed eight of its first 11 shots in the second half. Eddins capped the Blazers' run by scoring six straight points for a 51-41 lead with 13:30 left. The closest Marquette would get after that was with 5:06 left, when Dameon Mason's 3-pointer cut UAB's lead to 66-58.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
